required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A NON-INTERVENTIONAL STUDY ON AVELUMAB USE IN PATIENTS WITH ADVANCED OR METASTATIC UROTHELIAL CARCINOMA
clinical_study.official_title: AVENANCE - A Non-interventional Study to Provide Real-world Data on the Use of Avelumab as a Maintenance Treatment for Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Urothelial Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: A multicenter ambispective (retrospective and prospective) non-interventional study of patients with locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma (adv/mUC) treated with avelumab in France, not impacting the treatment decision made by the treating physician and the medical management of treated patients.

primary_outcome.description: time between the first injection of avelumab and the date of death from any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: overall Survival from the start of the chemotherapy used in 1st line
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1st line Chemotherapy start up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: time between the first injection of the chemotherapy used in 1st line and the date of death from any cause.
time between the first injection of avelumab and the date of progression or death from any cause.
time between the first injection of avelumab and the date of progression or death from any cause during the 2nd line of treatment post-avelumab.
Complete Response or Partial Response as a best response during the avelumab treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Beginning of response up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: time between the beginning of the response and progression or death from any cause.
time between the first and last dose of avelumab.
Metastatic sites and type of progression (new lesion(s)/progression of known lesion(s)).
Adverse events (AEs) of any type, grade 3-4 AEs, AEs leading to interruption or discontinuation, AEs leading to death.
Proportion of patients who received a premedication at each injection of avelumab. Median number of cycles with premedication.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Initiation of avelumab, 6 weeks, 3 months, and every three months for up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Evolution of PROs NCCN/FACT FBlSI-18 and EQ-5D-5L scores during avelumab treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate on subsequent treatments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Discontinuation of avelumab up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Response or Partial Response as a best response during the subsequent treatments

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Discontinuation of avelumab up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: time between the first and last dose of subsequent treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression free survival on subsequent treatments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Discontinuation of avelumab up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: time between the first dose of subsequent treatment and the date of progression or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Discontinuation of avelumab up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: time between the first dose of subsequent treatment and the date of death from any cause

arm_group.arm_group_label: Locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma patients treated with avelumab

intervention.description: As provided in real world practice
intervention.arm_group_label: Locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma patients treated with avelumab

study_pop.textblock: Patients with advanced or metastatic Urothelial Carcinoma treated with avelumab as a maintenance treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patient â‰¥ 18 years of age
2. Patient with locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma (irrespective of tumor histology) whose disease has not progressed (ongoing stable disease, partial response or complete response) following completion of first-line platinum-based chemotherapy and who has been (restrospective), is (retropsectifve and prospective), will be (prospective) treated with avelumab.
- For a patient alive at the moment of the inclusion in the study : the patient must be informed of the study, he/she must be given an information letter signed by the investigator and must not be opposed to the collection of his/her data
- For a patient who died before the inclusion in the study : the family of the patient must be informed and the patient (during his lifetime) must not be opposed to the collection of his data.
3. Patient benefiting from a social security scheme according to local regulations
Exclusion Criteria:
4. For a patient alive at the moment of the inclusion in the study: patient without liberty, under tutelage, or unable to give oral consent.
5. Patient enrolled in a prospective interventional clinical trial assessing an investigational product.

facility.name: Groupe Hospitalier Mutualiste de Grenoble Institut Daniel Hollard

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
